election_record.label: Maryland 1805 Governor

overview.note: "Monday, November 11. A message was received from the senate, notifying that they had formed a house, and were ready to proceed with the business of the session. Also a message, proposing immediately to proceed to the election of a governor, nominating the honorable Robert Bowie...A message sent to the senate, agreeing to go into the election of a governor immediately...The house having qualified for that purpose, proceeded to the choice of a governor, and upon examining the ballots it appeared that Robert Bowie, Esq. had a majority of votes; whereupon Robert Bowie, Esq. was declared governor of the State of Maryland." Republican Star or Eastern Shore General Advertiser (Easton, MD). November 19, 1805.

election_record.reference: Votes and Proceedings of the Maryland State Senate.
Republican Star or Eastern Shore General Advertiser (Easton, MD). November 19, 1805.
